citations.narrative:
- There are no records being kept to record the required annual physical examinations for dogs on hand. Routine physical
examination is an important tool to maintain adequate health. Proper medical records are critical in tracking an animal's
medical history and aid in making informed veterinary decisions. Licensees must ensure that each dog receives a
complete head to tail physical examination at least once a year, and keep appropriate medical records to document these
visits.
Correct from 2 January 2025 onward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee.
n

narrative:
3.13(b) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
- There are no records being kept to record the required annual physical examinations for dogs on hand. Routine physical 
examination is an important tool to maintain adequate health. Proper medical records are critical in tracking an animal's 
medical history and aid in making informed veterinary decisions. Licensees must ensure that each dog receives a 
complete head to tail physical examination at least once a year, and keep appropriate medical records to document these 
visits. 
Correct from 2 January 2025 onward. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee. 
 
 n
